metadata.dc:author: Retamales Rojas, R
metadata.dc:description: The concept of alexithymia, which is the inability to express feeling in words, was studied with projective tests applied to 75 subjects; psychosomatics, neurotics and somatoform patients and a control group. The most important characteristic of alexithymia is the cognitive disturbance identified in the Rorschach test. Also, the Archetypal test with Nine Elements is a good instrument for assessment the symbolic function in the alexithymia.
metadata.dc:title: Diferentes "tests" de personalidad aplicados al concepto de la alexitimia.
[Different personality tests applied to the concept of alexithymia].
metadata.dc:publisher: Actas luso-espanolas de neurologia, psiquiatria y ciencias afines
